intro: Gymnouratella pendula, commonly known as the hanging fern, is a unique plant characterized by its delicate, cascading fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features small, bright green leaves that hang from its stems, creating a visually striking appearance. Gymnouratella pendula thrives in humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for hanging baskets and shaded garden areas.
